quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Crocodile and Dinosaurs
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, breed, retriever. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Mammals lived alongside dinosaurs.
What is the average incubation period of crocodile eggs?
Which of these is NOT a species of crocodile?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: African Crocodile

questions.question: Crocodiles sex is determined by the temperature of their nest.
A crocodile bite strength is up to how many pounds psi (per square inch)?
In 2006, a crocodile housed at the Australia Zoo, was estimated to be 130 years old.
Some dinosaurs swam in the oceans.
According to data from the year 2001, crocodiles were the second leading cause of animal related death worldwide, second to venomous snakes.
The giant four-legged dinosaurs such as Apatosauras and Diplodocus are known as Theropods.
The Labrador breed comes in 3 different colors.
The Labrador Retriever is considered a medium-sized dog. How much does it weigh when fully grown?
What is the estimated average lifespan of a crocodile?
On which of these continents can you find the Salt Water Crocodile?
Tyrannosaurus Rex means Tyrant Lizard King.
All dinosaurs died out due to a meteor hitting the Earth.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Beaver and Butterfly
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, breath, coin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Finish this old phrase:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: takes a message

questions.question: A beaver will build a dam even in dried up waterways if a recording of rushing water is played.
You can kill a butterfly if you hold its wings.
Can a beaver hold its breath underwater for more than 30 minutes?
The butterfly is a relative to the crab and the lobster.
This is what mostly attracts a butterfly to a flower.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The flowers nectar

questions.question: The expression social butterfly is often used to describe a woman. It means that she does this.

options.text: Flits from one person to another

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flits from one person to another

questions.question: In Europe, the European Beaver (Castor fiber) was almost wiped out. It was driven to near extinction because of its fur and its scent gland that was used for medicinal purposes.
What is the gestation period of a beaver?
Butterflies do not have lungs. They breathe trough this organ.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The abdomen

questions.question: Butterflies taste their food through this organ.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The legs

questions.question: Butterflies need the warmth of the sun in order to fly. They cannot possibly fly if the temperature is below this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 50 F (10 C)

questions.question: Beavers are the second largest rodents in the world after which animal?
In the 17th century a ban was placed on eating meat during lent but the beaver meat was not included in that ban.
The North American Beaver is Canadas National symbol that adorns which Canadian coin?

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Cats and Cat
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, food, cats. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Why do cats like to sleep in the sun?

options.text: To make up for the drop in body temperature when they sleep
To keep from shedding so much
It reminds them of being kittens
Because they can hear better when they are warm

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To make up for the drop in body temperature when they sleep

questions.question: Cats are so curious because they are always looking for food.
Cats only purr when they are happy.
How many known species of earthworm exist worldwide?
Why do cats seem to be attracted to the one person who doesnt like cats?

options.text: Kitty thinks that person has food
Kitty wants to win them over
Kitty sees that person as unintimidating

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kitty sees that person as unintimidating

questions.question: Why does a cat rub against your leg?

options.text: Because she/ he really likes you.
To mark you by depositing his/ her scent
To show he/ she trusts you

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To mark you by depositing his/ her scent

questions.question: Worm casts (waste) is richer in nutrients and essential particles than the first 6 inches of topsoil.
Why do cats go crazy over catnip?

options.text: Because it smells like a cat in heat
Because it smells like tasty food

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because it smells like a cat in heat

questions.question: Why do cats always want in when they are out, and out when thery are in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To re-mark their scent

questions.question: Why does your cat interrupt you and want petting when youre on the phone?

options.text: your cat thinks you are talking to him/ her
to be a part of your telephone call
your cats is jealous that youre talking to someone else

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: your cat thinks you are talking to him/ her

questions.question: Why do cats suddenly race through the house?

options.text: They feel a change in the weather.
They have an overflow of pent-up energy.
They want to get your attention.
They feel the presence of a ghost.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They have an overflow of pent-up energy.

questions.question: Why does a cat bury his/ her waste?

options.text: To protect their trail from predators
Because they are very clean animals.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To protect their trail from predators

questions.question: How many hearts does a typical earthworm have?
The Giant Gippsland Earthworm, the largest species of earthworm, can reach nearly 10 feet in length.
A cats memory is about half as retentive as a dogs.

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Octopuses and Earthworms
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, earthworms, bears. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Why do earthworms come to the surface after rainstorms?

options.text: The temperature on the surface is cooler.
They cant take the acid rain.
They can drown if their holes fill up.
No one knows for sure but there are four theories trying to explain this behaviour.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No one knows for sure but there are four theories trying to explain this behaviour.

questions.question: To which animal class do octopuses belong?
Octopuses are known to kill sharks.
How many million of earthworms were exported from Canada and sold worldwide in 1980?
Which of the following animals is the least related to the octopus?
Approximately how tall is a grizzly bear when standing on its hind legs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8 feet (2.4 m)

questions.question: As far as disguising is concerned, octopuses are among the most proficient species in nature.
Grizzly bears can be found in Europe and North America.
Is soil pollution one of the biggest threats to earthworms?
One of the biggest threats to earthworm survival in the UK is the New Zealand Roundworm which feeds on earthworms.
Octopuses can live in fresh water.
How many species of earthworm are native to Australia?
Rich soil may contain up to 100,000 earthworms per square acre.
Octopuses can not be kept as pets.
How many arms do octopuses have?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Dog and Grizzly
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, bears, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: As a general rule, the bigger a dog is the more it should be exercised (walks, playing fetch, etc.)
Grizzly bears are strict carnivores.
A dog should never be left with a child under this age because the child may injure the dog or him/herself.
Which of these things is something you should never feed your dog?
How many fatal brown and grizzly bear attacks have been reported between 1900 and 2003 in North America?
Which of these do grizzly bears eat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Dogs sweat through their skin, like humans.
Should you feed a small dog, such as a miniature poodle, the same amount of food you should a large dog, for example a great dane?
In which country is the grizzly bear listed as a threatened species?
Although the grizzly bear is on the flag of this state, the last grizzly was shot there in 1922.
The grizzly bear is a subspecies of the brown bear.
A water bowl should be kept within easy access for your dog at all times.
Grizzly bears hibernate through the winter.
Which of these is only a dog food brand?
The dodos other name was The Robert Don.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Cheetahs and Dodo
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mean, lack. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: There is an intact dodo egg specimen housed in the East London museum in South Africa.
Cheetahs are only found in Africa.
Are there any complete dodo skeletons anywhere in the world?
The gestation period of a cheetah is about 90-95 days.
The dodo was able to grow so large and become flightless because of the lack of natural predators on the island it inhabited.
In what year was the dodo discovered?
What are cheetahs that have mutated patterning that creates blotches instead of spots called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Cheetahs

questions.question: Which of these is not a sound made by cheetahs?
Are their any complete dodo specimens anywhere in the world?
The does “cheetah” mean translated from Sanskrit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spotted One

questions.question: The ruler of the Mughal Empire Akbar the Great was very enamored with cheetahs and it is said he kept a stable of how many of these cats?
What were the dodos closest living relatives in nature?
Unlike most cats, cheetahs prefer to hunt during the day.
In what year did the dodo become extinct?
The highest recorded speed a cheetah has obtained is 80 mph (130 km/h.)
